description: Mount Marcy (1629m) The first of the the Adirondack 46 High Peaks, this is the BIG one! Mount Marcy is the tallest mountain in New York, and that means a dawn to dusk expedition to summit and back in one day. Not technically challenging, but with plenty of varied terrain.
directions: Mount Marcy Trailhead: Most popular is from the Adirondack Loj lot, parking fee. Leave Lake Placid on Rte 73, turn right on Adirondack Loj Road.
title: Mt. Marcy
